result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam M. Durrant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No Contact with the victims, as named in the complaint, is left to the discretion of the supervising agent.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.  Defendant to complete a Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Court dismisses and reads-in an uncharged referral in 14WS462 a 5/20/2014 an incident occurring in Village of Hancock.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. No Good Time Credit. Court does not object to jail transfer.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned)-tpg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Response letter from Court to Attorney Ulrich
From Attorney Ulrich to Court regarding electronic monitoring

10:00 am case called. Defendant Adam M. Durrant in court with attorney Ryan S. Ulrich.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement has been reached. State moves to amend Ct 1 to Misd Battery 940.19(1) with repeater enhancer.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Court accepts amendment of the State.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1, No Contest to Count 3, No Contest to Count 4.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 3. Court will also dismiss and read in an uncharged count in 14WS462 referral. Statement by victim. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Ulrich.  Statement by defendant. Statement by court prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to ALL THREE COUNTS: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITION ON CT 1 ONLY-60 days WCJ with Huber. To Commence no later than August 22, 2014.  Credit for 12 days served. Court has no objection to jail transfer. CONDITIONS ON ALL COUNTS: DAAP, AODA and follow through,   Absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Contact with victims left to discretion of the supervising agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Bond to be applied. Appeal Rights Given.

ADDRESS INFO for Adam M. Durrant
Current: 8879 Co. Rd. BB, Plainfield, WI 54966 United States  (Effective: 07-29-2014)
Prior: W13332 Cty Rd C, Hancock, WI 54943 United States

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 9:15 am case called. Defendant Adam M. Durrant in court with attorney Ryan S. Ulrich.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Preliminary hearing and time limits for preliminary hearing discussed. Attorney Ulrich states the defedant wishes to waive the time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing. STC Scheduled - NOH Given. Attorney Ulrich makes a request for bond modification. Statement by DA Blader objects to request for bond modification. Court modifies bond to include contact with W. Durrant for employment purposes only.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 09:05 am.
from the victims requesting the no contact bond condition be lifted
from Atty Ulrich requesting the case be rescheduled to 9:15 on the same date - granted by the court
Ryan Ulrich
Initial appearance on April 8, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars.

Case called @ 1:07 p.m. Defendant Adam M. Durrant in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $2000 Cash Bond. Atty Keberlein requesting signature bond. Court orders $2000 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
